Ok, I think we're having a problem with units of measurement.

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Parts

Lists the parts as metric (t)ons (along with the map view ship info which uses metric tons), Kerbal Engineer Redux lists them as kg, so a Stayputnik probe core weighs 0.05t or 50kg under KE.

The lightest part in the game, not figuring for physicsless massless parts, would be the Cubic Strut and Octagonal Strut at 0.001t or 1kg. Even a simple thermometer or the 1x1 photovoltaic panel is 0.005 or 5kg.

Ok putting aside what it says the numbers listed are from the actual part and no conversion are ever applied.

I will look again but pretty sure engineer doesn't convert them either. But if it's the case I'll change it back to tons.

I am pretty sure the parts are listed in the VAB are in metric tonnes. I've screwed up two mission because I didn't get the weight right after I separated the lifter from the satellite. My personal preference would be to have it listed as a range in tonnes (e.g. 0.5t to 1.5t).

Anyways it's not possible to build a sat with this low mass. The smallest probe core has a weight of 0.04t (40kg) and it would be also not possible to get the required electric charge with this low weight

Edit: oh, now I see. KSP uses metric tons for mass. So then it is possible. Was just confused by the "kg" in contract description.

I would also suggest to have only max mass limitation for sats. It makes more sense for realism reasons. In RL you will not have more mass than necessary.

Edit 2: There is also a gap in mass calculation between MCE and MJ:

- MJ 5.703

- MCE 5.9

Mission Controller 2 is out of Beta Stage and Into Version 1.0.

Woohoo. Long Month or so of coding but pretty happy to take this into a non beta stage and release as 1.0. Thanks everyone.

Little note for you guys. With the RSS config added, some of the values in Contracts read off the config file now. Either make sure you use the Config file supplied or if you keep the old config file, you will have to load KSP and your save game, then exit out and come back in for the config file info to load into the contracts. If you don't follow these rules your contracts will freeze up. This WILL NOT delete you saved Contracts Archives.

I suggest completely deleting your Old Mission Controller Folder to keep it simple!

2. Fixed Editor Parts breakdown to Tons.

3. Fixed Editor parts Breakdown fuel cost, neglected to include the multiplier for Fuel on harder difficulties.

4. Fixed Editor parts Breakdown Mass should now only display up to 2 decimal places.

8. Reduced the Max and Min Electric Charge To keep in line with the Max Tons for Satellite contracts.

9. Added RSS config file to the Download. just replace the Orginal config file with New Version if playing with RSS.

10. Added most Satellite contract values to config file for easy RSS adjustments. Or other adjustments. This is manual adjustments from within the config file itself.
